intro: Homalobus laurentii, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant is characterized by its clusters of white, fluffy flowers that appear in winter, giving it a striking appearance. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Homalobus laurentii thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique floral display.
